question: What if the other person doesn't agree to do what I ask?
answers: Try to plead with them until they agree
look at whether your request is fair then adjust it if not
Don't ask any longer to stop the chance of an argument
feedback: Maybe your request was a bit much. If this is the case, try again with a request that treats both parties fairly

question: What if I accidentally word my desire in a harmful way and realize after I say it?
answers: Try to stop the conversation since it will only go downhill from here
Go with it. It's too late to go back
Tell the other person you'd like to rephrase and try again
feedback: Don't be too hard on yourself. If you said something that you wish was worded a bit differently, it's fine to try and rephrase it.

question: Speaking on what you want is important even if a solution is implied?
feedback: Even if what the other person should do seems obvious, saying what you specifically want is important to make sure that everyone's on the same page.
